entities.name: Articque
entities.description: Software company, subject of Project Inuk. Currently transitioning towards a SaaS business model (FY19A-22L), which has impacted its revenue structure, increasing recurring revenues. Its main cost line is staff costs. COGS include fees to TomTom Multinet and Blay Foldex, and hosting fees. Pays royalties to its founder based on CDO and AP revenues, which will be rescinded post-Closing of Project Inuk. Headquartered in Tours' suburb.
keyStrengths: Several decades of experience in developing innovative geospatial data-led solutions
Pure-play and best-of-breed approach
Top-3 LI platform providers in France
Cloud-based, powerful and scalable LI Platform
Unique proprietary no-code modeling approach
Highly versatile design adaptable to any organization size and type
Industry-agnostic technology applicable across various sectors (automotive, healthcare, public institutions, banking, housing, unions, etc.)
Platform easily integrates into existing IT systems
Platform can be populated by diverse data sources (proprietary data, public sources, open data)
Loyal client base with c. 630 clients in FY21A
Significant client longevity: 450 clients for >=5 years, 200 clients for >=10 years
High revenue spread with low client concentration (Top 20 clients accounted for 34% of FY21A billings)
Historically low churn rate (7.2% in FY22L, in line with historical data)
Strong domestic presence (97% of FY21A billings generated domestically)
increasingly recurring and profitable growth model
successful transition to full subscription-based licensing
smart granular execution of business model transition
Focus on Data & Enterprise solutions (inferred from #WeAreData&Enterprise hashtag on page image)
Successful business and technology transition to a SaaS model
Offers a well-honed SaaS solution with rich and intuitive functionalities
Developing key innovative capabilities in connection with big data processing
Proprietary dynamic modeling tool
No-code solution
Dedicated metalanguage
Widely accessible tool
Loyal client base
Diversified client portfolio
High revenue spread
Little or no dependence on a limited number of clients
horizontal and industry-agnostic solution
cross-industry client portfolio
sticky domestic client portfolio
ability to convert, retain and upsell its customer base
successful shift to a subscription-only model
strong growth in recurring billings
Direct go-to-market approach
Land & expand model
Sales conversion ratio >55% on active pitches
agile and close-knit R&D team
R&D team working together for 10 years on average
effective and highly-responsive R&D organization
strict and comprehensive IT and Data security plan
Utilizes best-in-class development tools
An all-in-one and business-oriented solution embracing differentiating advanced features (Dynamic Modeling Tool, Mapping Of Things, Wizards, Spatial Dashboard, forecast scenarios…)
A unified & easy-to-use solution accessible to a wide range of users – including non-technical users
Flexible & modular platform adjustable to a wide range of use cases
A cost-effective offering positioned in the affordable segment
A strong client portfolio established for over 30 years
Strong footprint in the private sector compared to some competitors
Subscription-based business model
entities.growthStrategySummary: Standalone based growth strategy. Key assumptions include: continue M2S switch on AP client base, continued upselling effort on existing client base, focus on repeat business, and new logo acquisition. The company also anticipates gaining market share. Revenue assumptions are built bottom-up by offering line and historical recurring/non-recurring contributions. Cost assumptions cover COGS, staff costs (hirings and inflation), external costs, other expenses, and taxes.
awardsAndCertifications: Listed on the data dock platform

entities.typeSought: Sale of up to 100% of shares
entities.transactionPerimeter: Articque's standalone growth strategy and financials, as part of Project Inuk. ChapsVision is also associated with this project.
dealRationaleHighlights: To assist the recipient (Business Partner, potentially ChapsVision) in deciding whether to proceed with further investigation of Articque.
Founder willing to sell the company to a strategic acquirer willing to pursue the development of the business
Turenne Capital seeking liquidity on their investment
Involves ChapsVision as a key party (e.g., potential acquirer/partner)
entities.description: Confidential transaction context (codename 'Project Inuk') concerning the target company Articque. This section of the document, titled 'Financials & Growth Strategy', details financial aspects and growth plans for Articque. The document is marked 'Strictly Private & Confidential'.
keyInvestmentHighlights: Supported by an increasingly recurring and profitable growth model in the wake of a successful transition to full subscription-based licensing
Business model transition across the product range largely completed through smart granular execution
Fueling recurring revenue growth and building up sustainable cash flow generation
Significant switching upsell potential from CDD to CDO/AP
45% of client base still running on CDD
Extensive additional conversion potential
Future consolidation of DataComposer and DataViz to unleash the power of big data analytics.
Massive volume of real time location data generated by the ubiquity of smartphones, mobile and business applications
Increasing number of business intelligence and analytics tools supporting location data analysis
Greater interest and awareness from corporations in using location data to accurately identify consumer behavior
Technology maturing with innovative features to be used within organizations
Growing level of criticality assigned to several use cases of location intelligence platforms
Considerable democratization of LI applications shifting from restricted areas for technical experts to becoming accessible by any business user
An all-in-one and business-oriented solution embracing differentiating advanced features (Dynamic Modeling Tool, Mapping Of Things, Wizards, Spatial Dashboard, forecast scenarios…)
A unified & easy-to-use solution accessible to a wide range of users – including non-technical users
Flexible & modular platform adjustable to a wide range of use cases
A cost-effective offering positioned in the affordable segment
A strong client portfolio established for over 30 years
Strong footprint in the private sector compared to some competitors
Revenues expected to reach almost €6.5m by FY24BP
Revenue CAGR of +24% over the projected period (FY22L-FY24BP)
Revenue mix switching towards additional recurring revenue, representing €5.3m by FY24BP (82% of total revenues)
Adjusted EBITDA margin forecast to improve up to 49% in FY24BP due to favorable scaling effect

entities.name: DDA & Company
entities.roleInContext: Advisor for Project Inuk. The full name DDA & Company France SAS was provided in the contextual information for this page.

entities.name: ChapsVision
entities.description: Company associated with Project Inuk, as indicated by the page footer 'Project Inuk - ChapsVision'. Likely the party for whom the teaser regarding Articque is prepared, potentially as a prospective acquirer or key stakeholder.

entities.name: DDA & Company France SAS
entities.roleInContext: Prepared the Information Memorandum for Project Inuk concerning Articque. All inquiries regarding the contemplated transaction should be directed to DDA contacts.

entities.titleName: Independent consultant in Marketing, IT and Project Management for EY and Social security organizations
entities.description: Set to leave the company by mid-April and will not be replaced (as per note 4).

entities.locationName: 149 avenue du Général de Gaulle – 37230 Fondettes, France
entities.officeSpecificInfo: Located in Tours’ suburb. Rent for the HQ was €107k in FY22L and €106k in FY21A, forming part of Articque's external costs.

entities.name: Articque Platform (AP)
entities.description: Platform used for creating interactive maps, managing housing stock, optimizing services, and translating data for statistical communication. A spatial dashboard is available using this product for Seqens, and an observatory is publicly available for DARES.

entities.name: Cartes & Données Desktop (CDD)
entities.description: The legacy on-premise version of CDO. Discontinued in 2022.

entities.name: Cartes & Données Online (CDO)
entities.description: The cloud-native version of the platform designed for SMEs requiring a limited number of seats. Core product that replaced CDD.

entities.characteristics: Market for geospatial solutions with players differentiated by functional coverage (Low to High) and price level (Low to High). Articque is positioned as a challenger offering affordable superior functional coverage.
entities.description: ETL is the tool supporting the extraction of data from one data source and its placement into another database

Refine customer knowledge through geospatial insights

entities.name: Location Intelligence (LI)
entities.description: Technology that unlocks and fuels business possibilities by refining customer knowledge through geospatial insights, leveraging operational excellence, enhancing business data intelligence by bringing geography into business data, and improving grasp of business environment by blending multiple data sources.

entities.name: Search Engine Optimization (SEO)
entities.description: SEO-oriented strategy: website’s search optimization though a defined content strategy, on-page SEO and user experience.

entities.name: Search Engine Advertising (SEA)
entities.description: SEA approach: paid marketing to generate targeted traffic to Articque’s website through pre-selected keywords.

entities.name: Location Intelligence (LI) analytics solutions
entities.description: Solutions that transform geospatial data into strategic insights to solve a variety of use cases and business challenges, improve productivity, data experience, decision-making and innovation, and empower clients’ strategies to drive growth opportunities, operational excellence and competitive edge.

entities.name: SaaS Platform
entities.description: A cloud-based, powerful and scalable Location Intelligence Platform embracing a wide spectrum of analytics requirements. Designed to accommodate any user, leveraging a unique proprietary no-code modeling approach to facilitate LI application development and access by non-technical resources.

entities.name: GeoCodage
entities.description: A geocoding service allowing users to locate large volume of addresses (customers, prospects, stores, etc.) from datasets to geographic coordinates (latitude, longitude, etc.) and to fix incorrect addresses.

entities.name: GeoService Data
entities.description: Made up of a selection of third-party databases, including socio-demographic and businesses data such as INSEE or SIREN® bases, used to enrich customers’ data.

entities.name: Carticque Basemaps
entities.description: Provides a range of third-party domestic and international basemaps including administrative or business-specific basemaps.
entities.pricingModelInfo: Sold as an additional module to the client

entities.name: Statistical Data Analysis
entities.description: The process of examining, interpreting, and modeling geographic data to uncover patterns, trends, and insights.

entities.name: No-code modeling
entities.description: A unique proprietary approach that facilitates LI application development and access by non-technical resources.

entities.name: Cartes & Données
entities.description: Articque's proprietary dynamic modeling tool. It features an intuitive, graphic, and ergonomic interface for iterative analysis of multiple interactive data layers, combining selected statistical data with basemaps. Designed as a no-code solution supported by a dedicated metalanguage, making it widely accessible. The design process (Source: Management for design process details) is staged into 4 main steps (Choose basemap and import location data; Apply desired statistical & data science processing; Pick most appropriate representation; Display output in the web interface) and 2 extra iterative steps for further analysis (What-If scenario analysis, Creation of business applications).
keyStrengths: Intuitive interface
Graphic and ergonomic solution
Iterative analysis capability
No-code solution
Supported by dedicated metalanguage
Widely accessible

entities.name: CDO
entities.description: Web application deployable on Windows servers. Composed of: Data Base (PostgreSQL in replacement of MySQL for rights, accounts, user roles and file management), .Net 4.8 Web Service and its API (performing spatial/statistical calculation, generating map representations and exports), and Symphony/PHP/Apache Web Application (making up the user interface and the map rendering engine in a browser).

entities.name: CDD
entities.description: Historical product with clients being converted to CDO subscription. 45% of Articque's client base still running on CDD, representing significant upsell/conversion potential.

entities.name: AP
entities.description: Web application deployable on Windows servers. Composed of: Data Base (PostgreSQL in replacement of MySQL for rights, accounts, user roles and file management), .Net 4.8 Web Service and its API (performing spatial/statistical calculation, generating map representations and exports), and Symphony/PHP/Apache Web Application (making up the user interface and the map rendering engine in a browser).

entities.name: Data Composer
entities.description: An easy-to-use Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) tool allowing non-specialists to integrate extremely large volumes of data to perform location-based analysis. Developed on PostGreSQL and .Net core. Currently in beta testing phase, planned availability by end Q4 2022 / Q1 2023.

entities.name: DataViz
entities.description: A cutting-edge web graphic rendering engine for tailored dynamic output visualization of large volume datasets processed by DataComposer. Aims to overcome current processing volume barriers and enable on-the-fly analysis iterations. Will replace Leaflet. POC completed; development to begin after DataComposer development is completed.

entities.name: Strategic Decision Making
entities.description: Any analytics or business intelligence use case where location-related data support strategic decision-making.

entities.name: Carticque & Geoservices
entities.description: Additional key features of the Articque platform. Followed similar trend to CDO & AP, with a slight slow in FY22L.

entities.name: Maintenance & Support Services
entities.description: Tightly-run maintenance & support services. For clients under perpetual licensing plans, maintenance is charged at 25% of the license price per annum. Clients under subscription are entitled to receive both Maintenance and Support services. Maintenance and support services consist in: Technical support by phone or email – with 24h guaranteed response times, Automatic updates of any solution (C&D, AP, etc.), Quarterly support calls, Go-Live and onboarding support for new clients. With the shift to subscription-based model, maintenance and support are bundled into the subscription.
entities.pricingModelInfo: Perpetual licensing: maintenance at 25% of license price per annum. Subscription: bundled.

entities.name: Legacy Product
entities.description: Details: Offering discontinued to new clients. Billing scheme: Annually in advance. Revenue recognition: Yearly accrual.

Sales Qualified Leads generated from qualified MQLs or directly through outbound prospecting and upsell activities.

entities.name: ICPs (Ideal Customer Profile)
entities.description: Predefined Ideal Customer Profiles targeted in prospecting campaigns. Defined by the Marketing team and revisited regularly in the SDR team.

entities.name: "20-day campaigns"
entities.description: Targeted campaigns for reaching out to predefined ICPs as part of outbound prospecting.

entities.name: Upsell campaign
entities.description: Campaigns conducted by the Customer Success Management Team on its existing client base.

entities.name: Articque Sales Process
entities.description: A well-honed two-pronged sales and marketing execution process. Source: Management. Comprises Inbound Process, Outbound Process, and Conversion Process.

entities.name: Outbound Sales Process
entities.description: Generates SQLs via Prospecting activities by the Inside Sales Team. This corresponds to stage 1b of the sales process.

entities.name: Sales Conversion Process
entities.description: Converts leads to customers, involving MQL qualification, sales closing, customer success management, and upselling. This covers stages 2, 3, 4, and 5 of the sales process.

entities.name: Outbound SQL Generation Process (Stage 1b)
entities.description: The marketing team defines ICPs (Ideal Customer Profile) supporting prospecting campaigns (Mail/Phone campaign by Inside Sales/SDR Team) resulting in the generation of SQLs (Sales Qualified Leads).

entities.name: MQL Qualification Process (Stage 2)
entities.description: Closing Team qualifies MQLs according to a set of criteria (project well-defined, achievable timing, relevance of Articque solutions, clear decision process) which are then promoted to SQLs.

entities.name: SQL Assignment and Sales Closing Process (Stage 3)
entities.description: SQLs from both inbound and outbound streams are then assigned to specific Account Executives by the Closing Team, who finalize and close the sale.

entities.name: Customer Success Management Process (Stage 4)
entities.description: Upon conversion, the Customer Success Management Team takes over during the contract lifetime.

entities.name: Upselling Process (Stage 5)
entities.description: CSM Team conducts upsell campaigns on its client base. If the prospect shows interest in upselling his current offer, he is assigned to the Closing Team as an SQL.

entities.name: Translating financial data of local authorities and municipalities into maps
entities.description: Challenge faced by La Banque Postale, solved using CDO. La Banque Postale generates interactive maps to make open data available to all (public and elected representatives).

entities.name: Publishing spatial dashboard presenting financial ratios of municipalities
entities.description: Solution implemented by La Banque Postale using CDO, presenting financial ratios of municipalities such as taxes and personnel expenses.

entities.fullName: Head of Financial Studies from La Banque Postale
entities.biographySummary: Provided testimony on the utility of CDO for La Banque Postale: “The spatial dashboard we are making available to everyone solves this problem. With CDO, elected officials can quickly get a picture of the situation. They see at a glance where their municipality stands on all criteria and in comparison, with others”

entities.description: La Banque Postale uses CDO since October 2018 to translate financial data of local authority into maps.

entities.name: Translating raw data into maps to communicate unemployment issues

entities.name: Public visualization of unemployment data via observatory

entities.name: Articque's Geospatial Solution Platform

A cost-effective offering positioned in the affordable segment.

entities.name: TomTom Multinet
entities.description: Supplier of multimodal spatial data (rail, road, road signaling, etc.) to Articque. Fees paid to TomTom Multinet are part of Articque's COGS.

Receives royalties from Articque, calculated as a percentage of revenues generated by Articque's products CDO and AP. These royalties amounted to €329k in FY22L and €204k in FY19A, and are planned to be rescinded post-Closing of Project Inuk.

entities.name: SaaS business model
entities.description: Articque has been transitioning towards a SaaS business model over FY19A-22L. This transition has adversely impacted the revenue line in the short term but led to a drastic change in revenue nature, with recurring revenues growing significantly.

entities.name: M2S
entities.description: An offering by Articque that contributes to its revenue increase, alongside new SaaS client gains and upsell to existing customers.

Articque's transition towards a SaaS business model. This adversely impacted the revenue line initially, resulting in a contracted revenue increase (+€535k since FY19A) but significantly changed revenue nature, with recurring revenues reaching 79% of total revenue in FY22L (up from 57% in FY19A).
All staff of Articque were transferred from Groupe Articque Solutions (the founder's holding company) to Articque Informatique.
Includes fees to TomTom Multinet, Blay Foldex, and hosting fees.
Includes fees to TomTom Multinet, Blay Foldex, and hosting fees.
Includes fees to TomTom Multinet, Blay Foldex, and hosting fees.
Includes fees to TomTom Multinet, Blay Foldex, and hosting fees.
Exclusively includes fees to TomTom Multinet for multimodal spatial data, fees to Blay Foldex for updated basemaps, and hosting fees in relation to CDO and some Articque Platform clients.
Includes rent, finance/marketing/strategy fees to consultants, and IT-related costs.
Includes rent, finance/marketing/strategy fees to consultants, and IT-related costs.
Includes rent, finance/marketing/strategy fees to consultants, and IT-related costs.
Includes rent (€106k for HQ), finance/marketing/strategy fees to consultants, and IT-related costs.
Primarily includes rent of Articque HQ in Tours’ suburb (€107k), finance/marketing/strategy fees to consultants and IT-related costs.
Represented 62% of revenues in FY19A. Workforce partly employed under Groupe Articque Solutions.
Represented 61% of revenues in FY22L. Main cost line of Articque. All staff under Articque Informatique.
Predominantly made up of royalties' fees paid to Articque’s founder (€204k in FY19A).
Predominantly made up of royalties' fees paid to Articque’s founder.

Predominantly made up of royalties' fees paid to Articque’s founder (€329k in FY22L).
